Little_Rock.Argenta Branch Library: The Argenta Branch Library is a branch of the public library system (known as the Laman Library System) of North Little Rock, Arkansas. It is located at 420 North Main Street, in the former North Little Rock Post Office building, a brick Georgian Revival building constructed in 1931 to a design by the noted Arkansas architect Charles L. Thompson. It was used as a post office until 2011, and was opened as a branch library in 2014.
